level.heading: TABLE OF CIVIL FINES AND PENALTIES (§ 31-825)

level.text: The civil infractions and their respective fine amounts set forth in this section are applicable to the operation of all public vehicles for hire.

These civil infractions and their respective fines do not include moving violations for which jurisdiction remains within other District, federal or municipal agencies and/or the Superior Court of the District of Columbia or other courts of original jurisdiction.
Civil infractions and their respective fine amounts shall be:
Failure to report to insurance carrier
Cell phone use prohibited while operating vehicle in compliance with § 807.2
Failure to notify the Office of Taxicabs of a change in information

Unlawful activities as outlined in § 816, threatening, harassing, or abusive conduct or attempted threatening, harassing, or abusive conduct as outlined in § 817 or violation of any affirmative obligation or prohibition outlined in Chapter 5 of this title
$500, Impoundment of the vehicle, license suspension, revocation, or non-renewal, or a combination of the sanctions listed in § 817
Failure to pull to curb to pick up

$1,000 or license suspension, revocation, or non-renewal or any combination of the sanctions listed

suspension, revocation, or non-renewal or any combination
The civil fines set forth in this section shall be doubled for the second violation of the same infraction within a twelve (12) month period.
Further the civil fine shall be doubled once more for a subsequent violation or violations of the same infraction within a twenty-four (24) month period.
Where a specific civil fine or penalty is not provided in the table of fines, the fine shall be one hundred dollars ($100).
